marketNews.title: ⚠️ US Involvement in Israel-Iran Conflict Determined in 2 Weeks
marketNews.content: White House Spokesperson, Karoline Leavitt, said on Thursday (19/6) that US President, Donald Trump, will decide within the next 2 weeks whether or not to attack Iran. Trump's statement delivered via Leavitt was softer compared to Trump's previous inquiry, which labeled the Supreme Leader of Iran, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, as an 'easy target' and advised Iranians to evacuate immediately.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway (Geopolitical and Market Reaction)
marketNews.content: The 2-week deadline set by Trump eased concerns about immediate US military involvement in the Israel-Iran conflict. Responding to this development, Brent crude on the futures market for the September 2025 contract fell -2.04% to around 75.5 US dollars per barrel in intraday trading today, Friday (20/6), although it is still up +3.7% over the last week. Meanwhile, the stock market reacted mixed by this afternoon, with Nikkei -0.22%, EUROSTOXX50 +0.8%, and S&P Futures -0.28%. Meanwhile, IDX Composite fell again by -0.88% today after falling -1.96% yesterday, indicating profit-taking actions along with increasing geopolitical uncertainty.

marketNews.title: Other hot topics you need to know...
marketNews.content: 1. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said that the government hopes Indonesia can sign a trade agreement this year with the Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU) led by Russia. This step is aimed at increasing the export demand for Indonesian commodities, including CPO, coffee, and natural rubber. The EAEU consists of 5 members: Armenia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, and Russia. 2. Chairman of Gaikindo, Yohannes Nangoi, said that together with the government, they are discussing finding new breakthroughs to boost car sales in Indonesia. Yohannes mentioned that these breakthroughs could be in the form of fiscal incentives or tax reforms, which will be announced if agreed upon. 3. IDX Director, Jeffrey Hendrik, said that the IDX proposal to reopen broker codes and domicile has been approved by the OJK, with an estimated implementation in July 2025. Later, the reopening of broker codes and domicile will be done not in real-time, with data sent during the recess after the first trading session. 4. IDX Director, Jeffrey Hendrik, said that they are studying the idea of adjusting the stock trading unit (lot size) to increase the liquidity and inclusivity of the Indonesian capital market. However, Jeffrey mentioned that its application will not be realized this year. 5. Damac Group's subsidiary in digital infrastructure, Edgnex Data Centers, will invest 2.3 billion US dollars or 37 trillion rupiah to develop data centers in Indonesia. Minister of Communication and Digital, Meutya Hafid, said that this data center infrastructure will be built on an area of 12 hectares in the Cikarang industrial estate, West Java. The initial phase of this project is targeted for completion in 2026 and will continue to be developed until 2028. 6. Several property issuers have announced their marketing sales realization during 5M25: 1) Agung Podomoro Land ($APLN) recorded marketing sales of 638 billion rupiah, equivalent to 17% of the 2025 target; 2) Metropolitan Land ($MTLA) recorded marketing sales of 775 billion rupiah, equivalent to 39% of the 2025 target; and 3) Perintis Triniti Properti ($TRIN) recorded marketing sales of 667 billion rupiah, equivalent to 37% of the 2025 target. 7. Cikarang Listrindo ($POWR) established a subsidiary named PT Energi Baik Alami, which will become a holding company in the renewable energy business.

tickerNews.title: ARCI Controller Reportedly Postpones Divestment Plan
tickerNews.content: $ARCI: Bloomberg reported that the controller of Archi Indonesia, PT Rajawali Corpora, has halted plans to sell ARCI shares because the company's financial position has improved following the rise in gold prices. PT Rajawali Corpora itself owns about 85% of ARCI shares and since 2023 Bloomberg reported that the conglomerate planned to divest ARCI with a valuation of around 1 billion US dollars. Although postponing the plan, Bloomberg sources mentioned that considerations regarding divestment are still ongoing and PT Rajawali Corpora might still decide to sell ARCI shares. Operationally, ARCI targets gold production growth of +25% YoY during 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: 93.4 koz).

tickerNews.title: BUMI: Completion of Wolfram Limited Acquisition Awaits Australian Approval
tickerNews.content: $BUMI: Bumi Resources stated that the completion of the transaction for the acquisition of Wolfram Limited is still awaiting approval from the Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB) in Australia. Wolfram Limited itself is a company engaged in gold and copper mining. BUMI explained that the acquisition of Wolfram is a strategic step in line with the company's transformation plan, where the company is currently initiating a diversification program into downstream and critical mineral sectors.

tickerNews.title: DEWA: Director Sorimuda Pulungan Resigns, Will Stay as Advisor
tickerNews.content: $DEWA: Darma Henwa stated that it has received a resignation letter from Sorimuda Pulungan from his position as a director of the company. The resignation will be effective after obtaining approval from the GMS on June 30, 2025. DEWA mentioned that Sorimuda will continue to support the company as an advisor.

tickerNews.title: ICBP and INDF Approve 2024 Dividend Payouts
tickerNews.content: $ICBP: Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur shareholders approved the plan to distribute the 2024 fiscal year dividend amounting to ~2.9 trillion rupiah or 250 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a ~41% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~33%) and indicates a dividend yield of ~2.4% as of Friday (20/6). Meanwhile, Indofood Sukses Makmur ($INDF) shareholders approved the plan to distribute the 2024 fiscal year dividend amounting to ~2.5 trillion rupiah or 280 per share. This amount is equivalent to a ~28% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~29%) and indicates a dividend yield of ~3.5% as of Friday (20/6). The cum date and payment date have not yet been announced, respectively.

tickerNews.title: SIDO Announces Share Buyback Plan Using Remaining 2025 Allocation
tickerNews.content: $SIDO: Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul announced plans to buy back ~320 million (1.1%) shares in the period of June 23 to September 22, 2025. The estimated fund for this buyback is 192 billion rupiah, which is the remainder of the buyback fund allocation previously announced in March 2025. SIDO also maintained the buyback price limit up to 760 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: IPCM to Distribute Final 2024 Dividend of Rp 19.92 per Share, Yielding ~6.8%
tickerNews.content: $IPCM: Jasa Armada Indonesia will distribute the 2024 fiscal year dividend amounting to ~125.2 billion rupiah or ~75% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~75%). This amount is equivalent to a final dividend of 19.92 rupiah per share and indicates a final dividend yield of ~6.8% as of Friday (20/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is on June 26, 2025, while payment is on July 18, 2025. Previously, IPCM distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 3.8 rupiah per share in January 2025.

tickerNews.title: ACES Same Store Sales Growth (SSSG) at -4.6% YoY in May 2025, Below Target
tickerNews.content: $ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of -4.6% YoY in May 2025 (vs. April 2025: -14.1% YoY, May 2024: +10.1% YoY). This result caused the SSSG for 5M25 to drop by -2.7% YoY (vs. 5M24: +11.1%), below the 2025 target which aims for more than +1% YoY. During 5M25, SSSG experienced contraction in all regions, with Outside Java region at -0.1% YoY, Java outside Jakarta at -3.7% YoY, and Jakarta at -5.4% YoY.

tickerNews.title: DSSA Subsidiary Launches Rp 1.5 Trillion Solar Panel Factory in Kendal
tickerNews.content: $DSSA: Kontan reported that Dian Swastatika Sentosa through its business entity, PT Trina Mas Agra Indonesia, has inaugurated the first and largest integrated solar panel factory in Indonesia located in the Kendal Industrial Estate. The factory, with an investment value exceeding 1.5 trillion rupiah, has a production capacity of up to 1 GW per year. PT Trina Mas Agra Indonesia is a collaboration between DSSA's subsidiary, PT Daya Sukses Makmur Selaras, with Trina Solar Co. Ltd. and PLN.

tickerNews.title: Momentum Trading Strategy Based on Momentum Trading Principles
tickerNews.content: "Momentum is not about guessing the direction, but about reading the force that drives the price to move." - Ariefhidayatst
